Detailed Description

BtUncancelableRequest is a child class of BtRequest and implements the common properties for request that can not be interrupted. Any further concrete requests that can not be canceled are not directly derived from BtRequest. Instead of this they should be child classes of BtUncancelableRequest.
See BtRequest for a complete description of Bluetooth requests.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtUncancelableRequest::Cancel (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Stop the exection of this request.

CancelRequest is used to stop this ongoing request. Requests derived from BtUncancelableRequest are generally not cancelable, so CancelRequest can be implemented here as a dummy function. This function does not cancel the ongoing request. It only returns FALSE to indicate a failure in the call to cancel an uncancelable operation.

Returns:
A BtRequestState containing the current state of exectuion for this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtUncancelableRequest::IsCancelable (   )  const [virtual]
 

Can execution of this request be stopped.

So kinds of requests have a very long duration. Most of these requests can be interrupted. Other request once submitted can not be stopped. So IsCancelable returns whether a request can be canceled or not. This function is pure virtual in BtRequest because it depends on the kind of request if it is cancelable. BtUncancelableRequest is the base class for all requests that can not be interrupted. So IsCancelable can be implemented here to return allways FALSE.

Returns:
FALSE: This request can not be canceled.

Implements BtRequest.
